title: Luminary Weekender | NYC
hero_caption: The Little Island in New York, New York
short_description: Celebrate art in the city that never sleeps.
header_description: The experience of art is inseparable from New York.
list_description: Celebrate art in the city that never sleeps.
description:
Join Jay Clarke, Rothman Family Curator of Prints and Drawings, for an art-filled weekend in New York City. Visit outstanding galleries, world-class museums, prestigious private collections, and renowned restaurants with your fellow Luminary. Explore Frick Madison and the Metropolitan Museum of Art with curatorial guides, enjoy an after-hours tour of MoMA, and take a trip to Little Island accompanied by one of the park's co-designers. Back-room access to top galleries and a farewell dinner at the Modern complete this impressive itinerary.  

To join the list of interested travelers, please reach out to luminary@artic.edu.

One of the perks of Luminary membership is the opportunity to experience art through travel. The Luminary Travel Program offers carefully planned trips complete with exclusive, behind-the-scenes visits to artists’ studios and private collections led by expert guides.

The program is a benefit of Luminary, and eligibility to participate varies by membership level. Domestic trips are open to those at the Luminary Bronze level and above, while as international travel begins at the Luminary Gold level. For additional details, please contact (312) 443-3535 or luminary@artic.edu.
